content.body: I see the “Change Array by copy“ proposal https://tc39.es/proposal-change-array-by-copy/ seems to have been implemented (and shipped?) in Firefox — https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1729563. Has it been implemented in any other browser engines yet?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I see the “Change Array by copy“ proposal https://tc39.es/proposal-change-array-by-copy/ seems to have been implemented (and shipped?) in Firefox — https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1729563. Has it been implemented in any other browser engines yet?

content.body:
I think it is still behind a compile time flag in Firefox.
It has started to ship in Safari tech preview. But the spec has changed (and could change again) since it was implemented there
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text:
I think it is still behind a compile time flag in Firefox.
It has started to ship in Safari tech preview. But the spec has changed (and could change again) since it was implemented there

content.body:
OK, thanks — then I’m going to suggest we close https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/9940 for now — rather than keeping it open indefinitely — and revisit it if/when things level out later.

That PR’s been hanging open for more than 7 months now, and in general I don’t think it’s so great to keep PRs open that long.

content.body:
I'm reading the `HostResolveImportedModule` description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when _referencingScriptOrModule_ is `null`.

If I have two iframes containing `<button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>`, does `import('./foo.mjs')` have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?
content.formatted_body:
I'm reading the HostResolveImportedModule description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when referencingScriptOrModule is null.

If I have two iframes containing <button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>, does import('./foo.mjs') have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
I'm reading the `HostResolveImportedModule` description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when _referencingScriptOrModule_ is `null`.

If I have two iframes containing `<button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>`, does `import('./foo.mjs')` have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?

I'm reading the HostResolveImportedModule description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when referencingScriptOrModule is null.

If I have two iframes containing <button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>, does import('./foo.mjs') have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?

content.body: the referencing script or module is more about fetch options or the base URL/referrer; it doesn't control which realm things happen in
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the referencing script or module is more about fetch options or the base URL/referrer; it doesn't control which realm things happen in

* I'm reading the `HostResolveImportedModule` description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when _referencingScriptOrModule_ is `null`.

If I have two iframes containing `<button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>`, does `import('./foo.mjs')` have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?

*

I'm reading the HostResolveImportedModule description (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule), and I'm confused about what happens when referencingScriptOrModule is null.

If I have two iframes containing <button type="button" onclick="import('./foo.mjs')">Click me</button>, does import('./foo.mjs') have to return the same module instantiation both times (third bullet point) and thus leak an iframe's Realm to the other?

content.body: But if it's the same referencing script/module both times, they cannot be executed in two different realms (because it can only be executed once)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But if it's the same referencing script/module both times, they cannot be executed in two different realms (because it can only be executed once)
